chapter.title: Review of three guiding questions
chapter.content:
Review of three guiding questions

We’ll finish up this course by reviewing our three guiding questions:

  1. Which federal laws affect adults with LD?
  2. What does choosing to disclose or not to disclose mean to adults with LD?
  3. How can information about LD be kept confidential?

chapter.title: Review of guiding question #1
chapter.content:
Review of guiding question #1

In exploring guiding question number one, we looked at three federal laws that provide rights and protections to individuals with LD. They are:

  • IDEA;
  • Rehab Act; and
  • ADAAA.

We looked at the similarities and differences of these three laws, and briefly examined key aspects of each to improve your understanding of how individuals with LD can better advocate for their needs and accommodations.

chapter.title: Review of guiding question #2
chapter.content:
Review of guiding question #2

In response to our second guiding question, we covered self-disclosure because that is the first step in adults with LD benefiting from the federal laws. Remember, self-disclosure is a multifaceted decision-making process. It takes effective communication skills, since an individual must determine where, when, what, and how to self-disclose.

chapter.title: Review of guiding question #3
chapter.content:
Review of guiding question #3

Once an adult discloses a learning disability and provides necessary documentation, programs have certain responsibilities to uphold the letter and intent of the laws and to maintain confidentiality.

We looked at some suggested procedures for maintaining confidentiality of an individual’s disability information, such as providing  written consent forms at intake, or before releasing information.

Finally, we examined several scenarios to see how the issue of confidentiality plays out in some real-world situations. Remember, broken confidentiality could result in a violation of an individual’s rights under the Rehab Act or ADAAA.

chapter.title: Participate in the forum discussions
chapter.content:
Participate in the forum discussions

Congratulations on completing Learning to Achieve’s Legal Issues, Self-Disclosure, and Confidentiality online course! We encourage you to stay involved in the LINCS Community and the LINCS Disabilities in Adult Education Group as you work to ensure compliance with federal laws designed to protect individuals with LD, and encourage your students to self-disclose their LD appropriately and confidentially. We encourage you to discuss and apply your newly acquired knowledge and learn about others' experiences in teaching and supporting adults with LD.
